name: Rosicrucian-Paracelsian Network
description: Intellectual network of the early 17th century centered on the Rosicrucian manifestos, German Christian theosophy (Jacob Boehme), Paracelsian medicine, and the Prague court of Rudolf II. Spans c. 1540-1700 and includes the T√ºbingen Circle, English Rosicrucians, the Hartlib Circle, and political patrons of the 'Rosicrucian hope.'

scope.exclusionNotes: Excludes later 18th-19th century Rosicrucian revival organizations (AMORC, Golden Dawn, etc.) which represent distinct movements. Focuses on the early modern network (c. 1493-1700) connected to the original manifestos.
